channel.title: SOLID Principles on Gov's Programming Thoughts
channel.description: Recent content in SOLID Principles on Gov's Programming Thoughts

item.title: The Dependency Inversion Principle
item.description: Objects should depend upon abstractions and not concrete implementations of their dependencies.

item.title: The Interface Segregation Principle
item.description: Objects should implement multiple specific interfaces rather than large catch-all interfaces.

item.title: The Liskov Substitution Principle
item.description: Any object implementing an interface must be substitutable with every other object which also implements that interface.

item.title: The Open/Closed Principle
item.description: An object should be open for extension, but closed for modification.

item.title: The Single Responsibility Principle
item.description: All objects should have a clear and singular reason to exist, and hence a clear and singular reason to change (be rewritten).

item.title: The SOLID Principles
item.description: The SOLID priciples are a good guide for creating maintainable applications.
